Episodic Memory.description: The mental system responsible for storing and retrieving specific personal experiences

Encoding.description: The process of transforming experiences into a memory trace

Retrieval.description: The process of accessing and recalling stored memories

Attention.description: The cognitive process of selectively concentrating on a particular aspect of the environment

Retrieval Cues.description: Stimuli that trigger the retrieval of a memory

Context.description: The circumstances surrounding the encoding and retrieval of a memory

Sensory Receptors.description: Specialized cells that detect sensory information

Perception.description: The process of organizing and interpreting sensory information

Focus.description: The act of directing attention to a specific stimulus

Selective Attention.description: The ability to focus on relevant information while ignoring irrelevant information

Environmental Cues.description: External stimuli associated with a memory

Internal Cues.description: Internal states associated with a memory

Environmental Context.description: The physical environment where an event occurred

Internal State.description: The internal physiological and emotional state during encoding and retrieval
